abstracts.cdata!:
The Lifelong Learning Project aims at
            supporting the Government of Argentina to consolidate,
            strengthen, and increase the coverage of a lifelong learning
            and competency-based training system for disadvantaged
            adults 18 years or older with the objectives for those who
            participate to: (i) enhance employability (for unemployed);
            and (ii) improve career opportunities (for employed). As of
            August 15, 2012, the loan has disbursed nearly US$170
            million or about 80 percent of total proceeds. Overall
            progress in project implementation is good. The targets set
            for some indicators such as the number of trained and
            evaluated workers have already been exceeded. The
            reallocation is necessary primarily to reflect some changes
            in the administrative procedures associated with project
            implementation. The method of contracting the orientation
            and employability youth workshops was changed from
            consultancy services to the use of a standard set of fees,
            as used by other training courses. The Ministry hired fewer
            consultants than planned because of a decision to
            incorporate gradually temporary staff into its formal
            structure. The Ministry also decided to finance some
            expenditures envisaged under the project using national
            resources in order to simplify internal procedures.
            Moreover, the number of trained workers (financed under the
            expenditure category of fees) has exceeded the project
            target. In addition, the initial amount assigned to category
            seven (youth stipends) was conservative as the youth
            employment program was new and its pace of implementation
            uncertain. In practice though coverage targets have been
            exceeded. Finally, the Ministry has decided to focus its
            efforts to promote the provision of second chance education
            to workers and youth on supporting the provincial education
            systems, instead of special projects.
